sen.j: 十円硬貨（じゅうえんこうか）は、日本政府発行の補助硬貨。
sen.e: Juen-koka (ten-yen coin) is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.
Juen-koka (ten-yen coin) is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.
Juen-koka (10-yen coin) is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.

sen.j: 十円玉（じゅうえんだま）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also referred to as 'Juen-dama.'
It is also referred to as 'Juen-dama.'
It is also referred to as 'Juen-dama.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを半角に訂正

sen.j: しばしば表と裏が間違われやすいが、平等院鳳凰堂が書かれている側が表である。
sen.e: The obverse and reverse sides of the coin are often confused; the side on which the Hoo-do Hall of Byodoin Temple appears is the obverse side.
The obverse and reverse sides of the coin are often confused; the side on which the Hoo-do Hall of Byodoin Temple appears is the obverse side.
The obverse and reverse sides of the coin are often confused; the side on which the Hoo-do Hall of Byodoin Temple appears is the obverse side.

sen.j: 表面には「日本国」と「十円」そして平等院が、裏面には「10」と製造年、常盤木がデザインされている。
sen.e: On the obverse side appear the letters 'Nihonkoku 日本国,' 'Jen 十円,' and Byodoin Temple, and on the reverse side appear the number '10,' the year of manufacture and stylized evergreen leaves.
On the obverse side appear the characters for 'Nihonkoku 日本国,' 'Juen 十円,' and Byodoin Temple, and on the reverse side appears the number '10,' the year of manufacture and stylized evergreen leaves.
sen.cmt: As "十円" was translated as "Juen" in the previous cell, I believe "Jen" is a typo.
sen.e: On the obverse side appear the characters for 'Nihonkoku 日本国,' 'Juen 十円,' and Byodoin Temple, and on the reverse side appears the number '10,' the year of manufacture and stylized evergreen leaves.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを半角に訂正

sen.j: 発行は1953年（昭和28年）からであるが、製造は1951年（昭和26年）からであり、製造年を表す刻印も「昭和26年」からである。
sen.e: Although it was issued in 1953 (28th year of Showa period), it was manufactured from 1951 (26th year of Showa period), therefore the earliest year incused on a ten-yen coin is '26th year of Showa period.'

Although it was issued in 1953 (28th year of the Showa period), it was manufactured from 1951 (26th year of the Showa period), therefore the earliest year incused on a ten-yen coin is '26th year of the Showa period.'

Although it was issued in 1953 (28th year of the Showa period), it was manufactured from 1951 (26th year of the Showa period), therefore the earliest year incused on a 10-yen coin is '26th year of the Showa period.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを半角に訂正（以下すべて半角に訂正）

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）から1958年（昭和33年）にかけて製造された十円硬貨には、その縁にギザがあり、俗にギザ十（ギザジュウ）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: As ten-yen coins produced between 1951 and 1958 have engrailed rim, they are nicknamed 'Giza-ju' (jaggy ten-yen).
As ten-yen coins produced between 1951 and 1958 have an engrailed rim, they are nicknamed 'Giza-ju' (jaggy ten-yen).
As 10-yen coins produced between 1951 and 1958 have an engrailed rim, they are nicknamed 'Giza-ju' (jaggy 10-yen).

tit.j: 金属としての十円青銅貨

sen.j: 青銅で造られた十円硬貨は、ソース (調味料)、酢、醤油、レモン汁、洗剤等に浸すと、表面の金属酸化物や汚れが溶出したり脱落して一見未使用硬貨のような光沢を放つ。
sen.e: Ten-yen coins are made of bronze, and as such, when immersed in Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, lemon juice, or detergent, the metal oxide and dirt on the surface are eluted or come off, and they look shiny as though they have never been used

Ten-yen coins are made of bronze, and as such, when immersed in Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, lemon juice, or even detergent, the metal oxide and dirt on the surface is eluted or dissolved, and the coins look shiny as though they had never been used

Ten-yen coins are made of bronze, and as such, when immersed in Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, lemon juice, or even detergent, the metal oxide and dirt on the surface is eluted or dissolved, and the coins look shiny as though they had never been used.

sen.j: これは古い十円硬貨をピカピカにするという子供の遊びにもなっている。
sen.e: Making old ten-yen coins shiny in this way is also a children's favourite pastime.
Making old ten-yen coins shiny in this way is also a favorite pastime among children.
Making old 10-yen coins shiny in this way is also a favorite pastime among children.

sen.j: しかしこのような処理は、硬貨を故意に腐食劣化させる行為であり、酸化を早めたり、緑青を発生させたり、質量を減らすことになる。
sen.e: However this also erodes and deteriorates the coins themselves, as it encourages the process of oxidation, develops verdigris, and reduces the quantity.
However, this also erodes and deteriorates the coins themselves, as it encourages the process of oxidation, develops verdigris, and reduces the coin's mass.
However, this also erodes and deteriorates the coins themselves, as it encourages the process of oxidation, develops verdigris, and reduces the coin's mass.

sen.j: 収集的価値を重んじる場合、硬貨にこれらの処理を施すことは禁忌とされる。
sen.e: In terms of the value of the ten-yen coins from collectors' point of view, giving such a treatment to coins should be avoided at all costs.
In terms of the value of the ten-yen coins from a collectors point of view, such treatment of these coins should be avoided at all costs.
In terms of the value of the 10-yen coins from a collectors point of view, such treatment of these coins should be avoided at all costs.

sen.j: 水たまりに十円硬貨を入れておくとボウフラが発生しなくなるといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that putting ten-yen coins in a puddle of water discourages the generation of mosquito lava.
It is said that putting ten-yen coins in a puddle of water discourages the development of mosquito larva.
It is said that putting 10-yen coins in a puddle of water discourages the development of mosquito larva.

sen.j: 2006年に日本銅センターが行った実験によって銅イオンの殺虫効果が確認されたが、なるべく新しい硬貨を使う方がいいという。
sen.e: The experiment carried out by Japan Copper Center in 2006 proved the pesticidal effect of copper ion, and according to the experiment, new coins have a better effect.
An experiment carried out by the Japan Copper Center in 2006 proved the pesticidal effect of copper ion, and according to the experiment, new coins are more effective.
An experiment carried out by the Japan Copper Center in 2006 proved the pesticidal effect of copper ion, and according to the experiment, new coins are more effective.

sen.j: なお十円硬貨にかぎらず硬貨を故意に腐食させることは、貨幣損傷等取締法により罰せられる可能性があるので注意されたい。
sen.e: In addition, one should note that the act of eroding coins including ten-yen coins is punishable by the Act for the Regulation of Damaging, etc. of Subsidiary Coins.
In addition, one should note that the act of eroding coins including ten-yen coins is punishable by law due to the Act for the Regulation of Damaging, etc. of Subsidiary Coins.
In addition, one should note that the act of eroding coins including 10-yen coins is punishable by law due to the Act for the Regulation of Damaging, etc. of Subsidiary Coins.

sen.j: 例えば、上記殺虫効果は、銅イオンが溶出することによると考えられるが、銅イオンが溶出すれば当然十円硬貨は腐食する。
sen.e: For example, the pesticidal effect described above is caused by the elution of copper ion from the coin, which of course causes the erosion of ten-yen coins.
For example, the pesticidal effect described above is caused by the elution of copper ion from the coin, which of course causes the erosion of ten-yen coins.
For example, the pesticidal effect described above is caused by the elution of copper ion from the coin, which of course causes the erosion of 10-yen coins.

sen.j: 1871年：旧十円金貨（本位金貨）発行。
sen.e: 1871: The old ten-yen coins (standard coins) were issued.
1871: The old ten-yen coins (standard coins) were issued.
1871: The old 10-yen coins (standard coins) were issued.

sen.j: 1897年：新十円金貨（本位金貨）発行。
sen.e: 1897: The new ten-yen coins (standard coins) were issued.
1897: The new ten-yen coins (standard coins) were issued.
1897: The new 10-yen coins (standard coins) were issued.

sen.j: 1950年：洋白発行計画があるも、朝鮮戦争による原価高騰によって計画中止となり、資料用を除いて全て廃棄される。
sen.e: 1950: Although there was a plan to issue nickel silver ten-yen coins, it was abandoned as the price of the material soared due to the Korean War, and the coins were disposed except those preserved for the purpose of documentation.

1950: Although there was a plan to issue nickel silver ten-yen coins, it was abandoned as the price of the material soared due to the Korean War, and the coins were disposed of, except those preserved for the purpose of documentation.

1950: Although there was a plan to issue nickel silver 10-yen coins, it was abandoned as the price of the material soared due to the Korean War, and the coins were disposed of, except those preserved for the purpose of documentation.

sen.j: 1953年：十円硬貨発行（製造は1951年から）。
sen.e: 1953: Ten-yen coins were issued (the coins were manufactured from 1951).
1953: Ten-yen coins were issued (the coins were manufactured from 1951).
1953: 10-yen coins were issued (the coins were manufactured from 1951).

sen.j: 側面にギザギザがついている（いわゆるギザ十）。
sen.e: They were so called 'jaggy ten-yen' with the engrailed rim.
These were the so called 'jaggy ten-yen' with the engrailed rim.
These were the so called ''aggy 10-yen' with the engrailed rim.

sen.j: 1959年：側面のギザギザがないものに変更される。
sen.e: 1959: Ten-yen coins were altered so as to have smooth rims, instead of engrailed ones.
1959: Ten-yen coins were altered so as to have smooth rims, instead of engrailed ones.
